revised_title: Spiral Structure and Chromosome Pairing in Osmunda Regalis
tldr: The author studied the spiral structure and chromosome pairing in the plant Osmunda Regalis using various technical methods. They found that the apparent shape of the chromosome is an external form of a spiral coil, which has significant implications for understanding chromosome behavior. The study provides detailed observations and measurements of the chromosomes, contributing to the knowledge of spiral structure in cytology.
